title: We saved up for five years to go on the 'world's best family safari' – did it deliver?
text:
Ever since our visit to Kenya in 2014, the children had been asking to go back to Africa. The result: Botswana and Zambia 2019 – five years in the saving, two years in the planning. The team at True Luxury Travel, our tour operator, had a simple brief: to send us on the world’s best family safari. But would they deliver?

After 20-plus hours of travel to Zambia (I won’t bore you with the details), we didn’t have long to wait. As soon as our boat headed down the Zambezi, it all kicked off: we passed a herd of hippos, a lazy crocodile and a giraffe drinking nonchalantly on the riverbank.

Taking a right turn on to a quiet tributary, we arrived at Sindabezi Island with its five magnificent off-grid chalets. Beds were quickly sorted – Matilda, our middle child, has autism, so one of the big challenges is “rooming”. We’ve learnt that the path of least resistance is to have a boys’ room and a girl’s room; it’s the best way. The children and, more importantly, my wife Caro and I know that this will give us the best chance of keeping Matilda in good spirits.
